session.description: The revelations by Snowden, the Falciani list or, more recently, the dissemination of Panama Papers investigation by ICIJ (International Consortium of Investigative Journalists) are examples of the open publication of critical data that has had a great social and economic impact worldwide. This main session addressed the benefits or inconveniences of these revelations, analysing whether they help or hinder good governance and global Open Data sector. This session gathered three panelists who have worked in some of the most known leaks, including the whistleblower Hervé Falciani and the data journalist Mar Cabra (ICIJ). These were the key messages:

tweets.content: @miskaknapek: #iodc16 - Breaking the Power of Closed - with @martintisne @cabralens, Nerve Falacini & Javier Morenopic.twitter.com/XdTYamqjlf

conference_notes:
• -Mar Cabra (ICIJ): “Data leaks are a great support to uncover unknown subjects for the whole society, and at the same time, they highlight and accelerate key issues related to transparency, opening new frontiers for open data sector”.
  • Hervé Falciani (Whistleblower): “The openness of the information not only generates new conversations but empowers citizens”.
  • Javier Moreno (European Newspaper Alliance): “Ethical limits are essential: citizens had needed many centuries to achieve the right to privacy and data leaks could be a violation of that right if they are not conducted with due care”.
name: Breaking the Power of Closed
